5.63. 
Procedure for the lodging and satisfaction of creditors' claims
1. The creditors of the deceased shall have the right, within three months from the date of the occurrence of the succession, to lodge claims against the heirs who have accepted the succession, the executor of the will or the administrator of the estate, or to bring an action in court in respect of the property of the succession.
2. Claims shall be made irrespective of the expiry of the time-limits for their settlement.
3. The procedure for the submission of claims by creditors of the deceased set out in paragraphs 1 and 2 shall not apply to claims based on mortgages and pledges, nor to claims relating to the operation of the heritable individual (personal) enterprise or farm. Claims relating to the activities of the heritable undertaking or holding shall pass to the heirs and shall be realised in accordance with the transactions concluded by the deceased, except in the case of an insolvent heritable undertaking or holding.
4. The court may extend the time-limit provided for in paragraph 1 of this Article if the time-limit has been missed for important reasons and if not more than three years have elapsed since the date of the succession.
